diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute uncomplicated diverticulitis was supported by the presence of extensive colonic diverticulosis with mural thickening and pericolonic stranding noted within the proximal transverse colon at the hepatic flexure on the CT scan. The patient also presented with worsening abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea, and inability to tolerate food, which aligns with the clinical presentation of diverticulitis.
